metadata.Title: CVE-2023-25735 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Cross-compartment wrappers wrapping a scripted proxy could have caused objects from other compartments to be stored in the main compartment resulting in a use-after-free after unwrapping the proxy. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 110, Thunderbird < 102.8, and Firefox ESR < 102.8.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-25735` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmozjs-102-0 - 102.11.0-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: mozjs102 package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '102.11.0-0ubuntu0.23.04.1').
mozjs78 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
